paper_abstract: As more and more services are provided by servers via the Internet, Denial-of-Service (DoS) attacks pose an increasing threat to the Internet community. A DoS attack over-loads the target server with a large volume of adverse requests, thereby rendering the server unavailable to "well-behaved" users. In this paper, we propose two algorithms that allow attack targets to dynamically filter their incoming traffic based on a distributed policy. The proposed algorithms defend the target against DoS and distributed DoS (DDoS) attacks and simultaneously ensure that it continues to serve "well-behaved" users.
paper_title: TRAWLING TRAFFIC UNDER ATTACK OVERCOMING DDoS ATTACKS BY TARGET-CONTROLLED TRAFFIC FILTERING
